1.content:
This smoothie is one of my go-to favorites. It's simple, yummy, and healthy.

I don't typically measure out portions for my drinks, but I'll do what I can here.

10-15 frozen mango chunks
A splash of (soy/almond/regular) milk
3 heaping (regular) spoons of green tea matcha powder

Put the mango chunks in the blender. Pour in the milk so it goes to about halfway to the top of the mangos. You can adjust as necessary if you prefer your smoothies thicker/thinner. Dump in the matcha powder. Blend and enjoy!

**My smoothies usually turn out more like sorbet, so add in more liquid if you want to drink your smoothie, instead of eat it**
1.title: Mango-matcha smoothie

11.content:
Serves 2 ~ BIG breakfast burrito's!

Ingredients:
* 3 Eggs (beat)
* 2 Strips of crumbled, cooked bacon or 2 crumbled cooked pork breakfast sausage patties.
* 2 TBSP Salsa of choice
* 2 TSP Butter or Margarine
* 2 12" Flour tortilla's
* 4 Slices white or yellow American cheese. Or use cheese of choice. American is smooth and creamy on these, and so good! Just saying! Pepper-jack is pretty good too!
* Salt / pepper/ seasoning as desired. (Cilantro is nice, if you like a little spice.)

(Optionally, if you really enjoy a nice spicy kick, add some diced jalapeño as well, when adding salsa.)

Melt butter over medium to medium high heat in a medium sized skillet. While butter is melting, place a flour tortilla on a microwave safe plate (x2). Split a slice of cheese in half and lay one half in the center of the tortilla beginning at one edge, then place the other half in center as well, but going further into the tortilla. (leave about 2" of opposite edge bare.) Repeat with second tortilla.

Pour beaten eggs into melted butter in pre-heated skillet. Add salt, pepper, seasoning of choice then stir frequently to prevent over cooking. When eggs are almost set, add the salsa and sausage or crumbled cooked bacon and fold in. Once cooked and set, remove from heat and equally divide between the two tortilla's, placing egg mixture over the center on top of the cheese. Take remaining two cheese slices, break in half, and lay over egg filling on each tortilla.

Microwave each tortilla separately for 30 seconds or until cheese begins to melt and tortilla is soft and pliable. Wrap in the customary burrito style. Lay seam side down and allow to cool for 30 to 60 seconds. Enjoy!
11.title: Yummy Breakfast Burritos

111.content:
A meal for one- Overeasy eggs

2 Eggs
2 Bread slices
Garlic Pepper
Salt

Take A fry pan and add some oil or butter to the bottom so that the eggs won't stick. Put the bread into a toaster and turn the toaster on. When the fry pan is heated up then break the eggs and dump the eggs out of the shell into the fry pan. Season it with just a little bit of Garlic Pepper and Salt. Cover for a minute or two. Then dump the eggs onto a plate and turn off the stove. Take the bread out of the toaster. Now you'll have overeasy eggs and toast to enjoy. Can add butter or jelly to the toast for flavor on the toast.
111.title: Breakfast

12.content:
1 medium shallot, peeled and roughly chopped

2 cloves garlic, peeled and roughly chopped

1 15-ounce can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed

1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt

Juice of 1 medium lemon (about 3 tablespoons)

3 eggs (180 g, out of shell) at room temperature, beaten

1 cup fresh gluten free bread crumbs

3/4 cup (75 g) gluten free old-fashioned rolled oats

2 cups cooked quinoa, cooked in vegetable stock according to package directions (I used red quinoa but it’s all the same aside from the obvious (color))

3 to 4 carrots, peeled and shredded (125 g)

3 to 4 tablespoons ghee (or extra virgin olive oil), for frying

DIRECTIONS

Report this ad

Preheat your oven to 300°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with unbleached parchment paper and set it aside.

In the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade*, place the chopped shallot and garlic and pulse until finely minced. Add the garbanzo beans, the salt and the lemon juice, and pulse until mostly smooth. Add the eggs and pulse to combine. The mixture will have become relatively thin. Add the bread crumbs and rolled oats, and pulse until the mixture begins to come together. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl, add the quinoa and shredded carrots, and mix to combine well. Cover the bowl and place in the refrigerator until the mixture thickens and becomes firmer (about 15 minutes or up to overnight).

Remove the bowl from the refrigerator, uncover it, and, divide the mixture into 10 separate burger patties. Moisten hands with cool water as often as necessary to prevent the mixture from sticking to your hands. Place each shaped patty on a paper towel and blot it dry.

Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee in a large, heavy-bottom saute pan over medium heat until the ghee is melted and begins to shimmer. Place as many patties in the pan as will fit without touching one another and fry until golden brown on the underside (about 3 minutes). Flip the patties and fry until golden brown on the other side (another 2 to 3 minutes). Remove the patties to the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining patties, using the remaining ghee as necessary.

Place the baking sheet with the burgers on it in the preheated oven and bake for about 10 minutes, or until mostly firm to the touch. Serve warm.
12.title: Lunch - Gluten Free Quinoa Burgers

121.content:
This is a healthful recipe for everyone, I mean patients and others as well. It can be cooked without much fuss or trouble. Overall time it takes is about 45 minutes.

Ingredients-
Rice (brown or white) - 1 cup ( quinoa can be used)
lentils (any lentil that is available)- 1/2 cup.
Ghee or butter- 1 table spoon

vegetables-

Slice the following vegetables into either small or big pieces as per your wish.
carrots- 1 or 2
Beans- a handful
capsicum or bell pepper- !/2
onion- 1 small
tomato- 1 big one
ginger paste- 1 teaspoon

spices-

cloves-2
cinnamon stick-1 inch
cardamom-2
(You need not powder them)

Turmeric- half teaspoon
Dry chili powder- 1 teaspoon(optional)
salt as per your requirement.

Method-

It should be pressure cooked. It cooks well and the taste and the aroma are retained that way.

Take a skillet or a small sized cooker. Place it on slow fire. Drop ghee or butter in the skillet.

Fry the spices for half a minute. Add sliced onion and bell pepper.

A minute later, add ginger paste. cook for a minute. Then add other sliced vegetables.

Sprinkle turmeric powder, salt and dry chili powder.

Add 3 and a half cups of water.(Important)

Pressure cook for 20 minutes. Simmer and open after 10 minutes.

Steaming and Khichidi is ready to be served. Can be enjoyed with curry or any nonvegetarian side dish and cucumber salad or curd.
121.title: Vegetable Khichidi

13.content:
This is a simple, easy, healthy meal if you're feeling like ordering in some Chinese food but don't want to pay for it.

Here's what you'll need (for one serving):

1/2 cup white rice (or whatever rice you prefer)
1 boneless/skinless chicken breast
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 tablespoons of hot sauce (I use Frank's Red Hot or Taco Bell Mild)
2 tablespoons of honey
2 tablespoons of teriyaki (or soy)
Salt
Pepper
Garlic powder

Start cooking the rice as directed or in a rice cooker. This usually takes about 30 minutes, so starting this early is a good idea.

Put your chicken in a relatively deep skillet (because we're going to be putting sauce in there too), and turn the heat up to about halfway. Sprinkle a pinch each of salt, pepper, and garlic powder and cover with the lid.

While the chicken is cooking, take the remaining ingredients (brown sugar, hot sauce, honey, and teriyaki) and mix it all together in a bowl. Set aside.

Turn your chicken over and sprinkle again with spices. Cut the chicken open, to ensure it is cooked through, and then cut into smaller, bite-sized pieces. If some of the pieces are still looking a little pink, put the lid back on a let it cook a little longer.

Once you're satisfied that your chicken is thoroughly cooked (white on the inside, not pink), dump your sauce mixture into the pan and mix it all around so that all of the chicken gets covered in some of the sauce. Bring the heat down to low for about 5-10 minutes to allow the sauce to thicken and stir occasionally.

Once your rice is done, serve it up in a bowl and spoon the chicken onto the rice. If you really dig the sauce, just dump it all on.

That's it.


SIDE NOTE: If you're looking for a healthier way to have Sweet N' Sour Chicken, you can use this same recipe by swapping out the sauce ingredients for some pre-made sweet and sour sauce or a mixture of:

2⁄3 cup pineapple juice
1⁄4 cup water
2 tablespoons vinegar
2⁄3 tablespoon soy or teriyaki sauce
1⁄3 cup packed brown sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
13.title: Sticky Chicky and Rice

131.content:
At my house, we do not waste anything. I raised my kids mostly poor. So, to eat healthy, I learned not to waste anything. Even vegetable scraps that would normally be thrown away are saved for making homemade soup base. During the Great Depression and before soup bases could easily be bought at the local supermarket, this is how soup bases were made.

During the month, all vegetables cooked, save all of the peals and ends that you would normally throw away. Always make sure they are washed well before peeling. I keep a plastic baggy in the freezer for which I keep adding veggie scraps throughout the month. By the time I make my soup, I have a variety of vegetable scraps that includes tomatoes, onions, squash, asparagus, celery, bell pepper, Brussels sprouts, and carets. All vegetables are good to use, except for potatoes. Your broth will be much different than mine, but that is alright. Just make sure that you have a variety of vegetables in your base.


Homemade soup base

Boil at least four cups of vegetable scraps in twelve cups of water and a tablespoon of salt. Once you bring it to a boil, simmer it on med/low heat for a few hours. When vegetable parts are mushy and the broth is not clear, strain the liquid using a colander into another pot. Toss the soggy vegetables into the trash and only use the broth for your soup.

For beef soup, when you boil the vegetables, toss a raw beef bone into the pot of veggie scraps while boiling. For chicken soup, toss raw chicken bones into the pot of veggie scraps when you boil them. This base is also great for making a vegetarian soup. So, if it is meatless, do not use any meat bones in the base.

You can also make this base ahead of time and freeze it for later use.

This makes a great base for any soup, but below is a variation of one of my soups.


Beef refrigerator soup

12 oz can of stewed tomatoes
Tablespoon of basil (fresh is better if you have it available)
teaspoon of salt (little more if you think it needs it)
Pinch of thyme
two large cloves of garlic, minced
1/4 cup of diced white onions
1/4 cup of chopped celery
4 pealed and sliced carets
handful of fresh green beans snapped and cut in half
1 cup of shredded cabbage
10 Small organic purple and red new potatoes cut in half (if you can't afford organic, just use regular new potatoes)
one lb. raw beef sliced into half inch pieces (any except for ground beef)
Homemade beef and vegetable base

Add all ingredients in a single pot. Boil and simmer for approximately an hour. After tasting if you feel it needs more salt add it. Pepper to taste.

For this soup you can experiment with other vegetables if you like. Just make sure that you always use onion and celery. The other vegetables can be changed. You can also supplement the potatoes with pasta, but if you do, make sure to only throw in a few handfuls of raw pasta. Yes, raw, do not throw it in precooked. Well, you can, but it tastes better when the pasta boils in your soup broth, because the noodles absorb the flavors in the soup.
131.title: Refrigerater soup

1313.content:
I found this recipe some time back and make it fairly regularly. Frozen cod works fine, just be sure it's wild caught or comes from a nation you trust.

Baked Cod and Chorizo

Makes 6-8 servings


3 tablespoons olive oil
6 ounces chorizo or smoked sausage (such as kielbasa), thinly sliced
1 1/2 lbs Yukon gold potatoes (peel first if desired) sliced 1/4 in thick
3 Leeks- white and light green parts only-halved lengthwise, rinsed, and thinly sliced into half-moons
1 C low-sodium chicken broth
1/4 teaspoon crumbled Saffron threads
1 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
2 1/2 – 3 lbs cod fillets
1/2 Cup fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, roughly chopped


Heat oven to 400°F. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and brown on both sides. Add the potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes. Add the leeks, broth, saffron, 3/4 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of the pepper. Bring to a boil. Meanwhile, rinse the cod and pat it dry with paper towels. Season with the remaining salt and pepper. Place it on top of the potatoes and drizzle with the remaining oil. Bake until the cod is the same color throughout and flakes easily, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley and transfer to individual plates.
1313.title: Dinner- Cod and Chorizo

132.content:
Instant Pot Ginger Garlic Drumsticks

Prep Time: 5 mins
Cook Time: 19 mins
Serves four.

Total Time: 24 mins

I love this Asian influenced recipe for ginger garlic drumsticks. It is easy to make in that popular gadget The Instant Pot. Enjoy tender chicken in a sweet and sour sauce that's ready in no time.

Ingredients:

8 chicken drumsticks, skin on
1/4 cup water
1/2 cup soy sauce
2 tablespoons honey
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 teaspoon fresh ginger, minced
1/2 onion, chopped

Instructions:

1. In a bowl, mix the sauce ingredients: water, soy, honey, brown sugar, rice wine vinegar, garlic, ginger, and onion until combined.

2. Pour sauce into the instant pot.

3. Add chicken drumsticks and push them down so they are submerged in the sauce.

4. Put on the lid and set the valve to sealing. Press the manual button. Set the time for ten minutes. Allow the machine to do its magic.

5. When the timer beeps, allow the chicken to remain for 5 additional minutes during the natural release process. Then do a quick release of the pressure.

6. Remove the drumsticks and place them on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper.

7. Hit the saute button so the sauce boils and starts reducing. Preheat your broiler.

8. Broil the chicken drumsticks for 2 minutes on each side (or more if you'd like). Meanwhile, leave the sauce on the instant pot so it keeps reducing.

9. Remove the chicken from the oven and place the drumsticks on a platter. Pour sauce over and serve. This is great with white rice, brown rice, or cauli rice.
132.title: Instant Pot Ginger Garlic Drumsticks

133.content:
I am from a French Canadian Family and at Christmas Eve we always had tortieres, meat pies. Yum!
My pepere taught my English mother now to do it. She used to make steak and kidney pie from her heritage.

Pie Shells of Semi Rich Pastery:

3 cup. flour 3/4 teaspoon of salt
1 cup. lard 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
3/4 cup of water

MIx ingredients til dough can be handled. Roll it out on floured board. Makes roughly 2 , 9inch pie shells, top and bottom layers.

To Make Tortieres, add the filling (below} and cover with dough.
Bake at 450 F for 10 minutes and down to 350 F for 30 minutes.

Filling:
2 large onions 1tsp. garlic powder or 1/4 garlic clove
3lbs. ground pork 2 tsp. parsely, salt, celery salt (or chopped celery}
1lb of veal
Pinch of mace, cloves, cayenne,
Dash of pepper,
1 bay leaf

Saute meat.
Add about 1 1/2 - 2 cups oaf water ( or meat stock, bouillon}
Place all in large stewing pot.
Simmer 35-40 minutes.
(It may be thickened with 2tablespoons ofr water flour mixture).

Add to pie shell!

Enjoy with some homemade green tomoto pickle.!


Note: I don't do pork now. Ground beef or chicken can be subsituted as well. I remember we used to get the boullion by cooking a chicken in a pot for soup and then saving 2 cups for the pies. Easy now to freeze it to keep too.
133.title: Tortieres

134.content:
Blue Cheese Dressing

• 1 cup Mayo
• 1 cup Sour Cream
• 1 ½ tsp Lemon Juice
• 1/8 tsp Garlic Salt
• 1/8 tsp Celery Salt
• 8 oz Blue Cheese ( the bluer the better)

Blend all except cheese.
Crumble cheese and add.
Refrigerate 24 hours.
134.title: Blue Cheese Dressing

135.content:
1/2 cup of water
1 pack of ready-to-make BCD Soon Tofu
Veggies of your choice
Tomatoes (optional)
Meat of your choice

Follow the directions on the packaging. Boil the water and then squeeze in the paste. Drain the tofu and slice it in preparation for dumping in.
Pour in your veggies, tomatoes, and/or meat, and bring it all to a boil before you add the tofu.
Once the tofu is in, let the pot boil again.

Enjoy!

I recently made this and put in dumplings, carrots, spinach, and tomatoes. It's great for a cold day or if you're looking for something warm and soupy.
135.title: Dinner- Soon Tofu

14.content:
I call it fruity bread. One day I had a few apples and a few bananas, which was not enough to make banana bread or my apple cake, so I made an alteration.

Ingredients
One cup of apples cored and diced
two bananas mashed
one teaspoon of orange zest
1/4 cup of raisins
1/2 cup of butter softened
1 1/2 cups white flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 eggs beaten

Directions

1.Preheat oven to 350 degrees and greace and flour two bread pans.

2. In a mixing bowl cream together sugar, butter, orange zest, and eggs.

3.Add flour, salt, and baking soda. Mix until smooth.

4. Then add in bananas, raisins, and apples. Mix until fruit is well distributed throughout the dough.

5. Bake for approximately 55 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

It is great served cold, but my kids love it warm, fresh out of the oven with a scoop of vanilla ice-cream on top.
14.title: Dessert

15.content:
Here's a recipe you can try out. Like the smoothie above, it's pretty tasty. Unlike the smoothie, it's not particularly healthy, although you can limit the damage by using sugar-free and/or low-fat ingredients.

One 1 lb. canister of instant cocoa mix (Hershey's, Nestle, etc.)
One 8 qt. box of powdered milk
One 6 oz. jar of powdered creamer (regular or flavored - it's up to you)
One-halt cup of powdered sugar

Mix the ingredients in an appropriately sized container. Dump a couple of tablespoons worth into your favorite , add hot water and stir. You can nuke the water first, or use a teakettle; tap water probably isn't going to be hot enough. Enjoy it as-is, or toss in a few marshmallows!
15.title: Chapter 2 - Hot Chocolate mix

info.brief_description: A place for all WDC members to share recipes
info.description:
Welcome to The WDC Cookbook! Here, you can share recipes, find new ones, and learn about foods from other cultures.

This idea came from a comment on "Note: Just wanna share with you guys a...", plus the knowledge that some people (like me!) are completely inept in the kitchen.

Got a nice recipe? Please share!

And just for organization's sake, please try to keep all the meals in their own categories. Thank you!
